result.execSummary:
The defendant Starvos Monrico Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA surcharge during the course of probation to the probation agent.
Any remaining  balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time work and/or school.
Complete parenting class.

Provide DNA sample if not already  done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

No alcohol. No use or possssion of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No use  or possession of any drug without a valid prescription.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia including for personal use, manufacturing, distribution or delivery.
No possession of any firearms, including firearm ammunition.
No possession of cash (bills or coins) in an amount greater than $200.00.

Pay DOC supervision fees.


Court advises defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that defendasnt could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Without good time credit.  Release privileges for work only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Starvos Monrico Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Danielle Chojnacki for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 30 MONTHS.
Court orders Condition time: 9 months at the House of Corrections, without good time credit and with release privileges for work ONLY. 
Conditions of Probation and Extended Supervision:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No use or possession of any drug without a valid prescription. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia, including for personal use, manufacturing, distribution or delivery. 
- No possession of any firearms, including firearm ammunition. 
- Provide DNA Sample, if not already done. 
- No possession of cash (bills or coins) in an amount greater than $200.00. 
- Seek and maintain full time work and/or school. 
- Complete Parenting class. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including
  the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. 
  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due
  or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Pay Department of Correction supervision fees. 


Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 



Defense motions the court to allow release privileges for childcare. Court denies Defense motion for release for childcare. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Final Pretrial. Court proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court vacated the Jury Trial scheduled for August 18, 2014. Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing, Br. 17. 
Court reiterates: No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Parties reminded that effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/27/14. AR
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for Hanna R Kolberg for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial / Final Pretrial / Projected Guilty Plea / and Sentencing in Branch 26 and 17.   All parties were notified that effective August 4, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313, Safety Building.  Scheduling Order signed, received and filed with the court.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF2877 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Boelhke-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail on deposit shall be returned to the person who posted it.
The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Starvos Monrico Williams in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 05-17-2014. sdg
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/20/2014 at 1:30pm
